intro: Senecio orogenes, commonly known as the mountain senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Senecio orogenes is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
